required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Peer Coaching Intervention in Young Adults With Congenital Heart Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Peer Coaching Adaptive Self-Management Interventions for Young Adults With Congenital Heart Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate a peer coaching intervention in young adults with congenital heart disease.

detailed_description.textblock: Our research team has developed a peer coaching intervention that has been deployed to promote activated self-management for AYAs with several conditions, and this has been modified adolescents and young adults (AYA) with with congenital heart disease (CHD). This study will be conducted over two years and pair AYA with CHD with a peer coach who also has CHD has successfully navigated the transition to adult medical care and over six months will work to promote the motivation for self-care as well as the development of self-management skills. This pilot study will test feasibility and acceptability, as well as preliminary efficacy and long-term effects on successful transfer to adult cardiology.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Once enrolled, participants will be randomly assigned to the intervention or control group (1:1 ratio)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 months after recruitment closes
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the number of participants contacted about the study who actually enrolled

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 8 months after enrollment of each participant
primary_outcome.description: Determine the number of participants who enrolled in the study who completed it

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 8 months after enrollment of each participant
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the number of participant who stated the intervention had a positive impact on their health
Determine change in patient activation as measured by changes over time on the Patient Activation Measure (PAM)
Determine change in self-management as measured by changes over time in the Partners in health Scale (PIH)

secondary_outcome.description: Determine the change in transition readiness over 6 months as measured by the Transition Readiness Assessment Questionaire (TRAQ)

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine change in health related quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the change in health related quality of life over 6 months as measured by the Short-From 12 (SF-12)
Determine the change in emotional health over 6 months as measured by the Brief Symptom Inventory (BSI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate successful transfer of participants from pediatric to adult cardiology care
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate number of participants that transfer from pediatric to adult cardiology care with at least consecutive visits 10 years post study

arm_group.description: Participant receive a 6 month peer health coaching intervention.
Participants receive education-only material (newsletter) biweekly for 6 months

intervention.description: The Peer Coaching group will receive 6 months of peer health coaching via a secure telephone and text messaging system.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-26
- Diagnosis of congenital heart disease
- Patient at a Duke pediatric cardiology clinic
- Access to a smart phone
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cognitive delay
- Patient at an adult cardiology clinic
